a larger number of events than usual, especially unpleasant ones, happening at about the same time: spate of Police are investigating a spate of burglaries in the Kingsland Road area. in (full) spate UK
If a river is in (full) spate, it has more water in it and is flowing faster than it usually does: The stream was in full spate and we struggled to cross it.
